org.jerkar.api.utils

Class JkUtilsString

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.utils.JkUtilsString

  • public final class JkUtilsString
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for dealing with strings.

      • splitTrimed

        public static java.lang.String[] splitTrimed(java.lang.String str,
                                             java.lang.String delimiters)
        Splits the specified String into an array by separating by the specified delimiter. Items are trimmed to eliminate blank spaces. If str is null then it returns an empty array.

      • substringAfterLast

        public static java.lang.String substringAfterLast(java.lang.String string,
                                                  java.lang.String delimiter)
        Returns the substring after the last delimiter of the specified occurrence. The delimiter is not part of the result.

      • substringBeforeFirst

        public static java.lang.String substringBeforeFirst(java.lang.String string,
                                                    java.lang.String delimiter)
        Returns the substring before the first delimiter of the specified occurrence. The delimiter is not part of the result.

      • substringAfterFirst

        public static java.lang.String substringAfterFirst(java.lang.String string,
                                                   java.lang.String delimiter)
        Returns the substring after the first delimiter of the specified occurrence. The delimiter is not part of the result.

      • substringBeforeLast

        public static java.lang.String substringBeforeLast(java.lang.String string,
                                                   java.lang.String delimiter)
        Returns the substring before the last delimiter of the specified occurrence. The delimiter is not part of the result. Returns empty string if not found.

      • repeat

        public static java.lang.String repeat(java.lang.String pattern,
                                      int count)
        Returns a string made of the the specified pattern repeat the specified count. So, for example, repeat("##", 3) will return ######

      • plurialize

        public static java.lang.String plurialize(int count,
                                          java.lang.String singular,
                                          java.lang.String plurial)
        Returns a string containing the quantity and noun. The noun is the plural form if quantity > 1.

      • plurialize

        public static java.lang.String plurialize(int count,
                                          java.lang.String singular)
        Returns a string containing the quantity and noun. The noun is the plural form if quantity > 1. The plurial form is singular form + 's';

      • parse

        public static <T> T parse(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                          java.lang.String stringValue)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create an instance of the specified type from its string value. For now handled types are :
        • primitive Wrapper types
        • File
        • Enum
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • elipse

        public static java.lang.String elipse(java.lang.String string,

        Returns the specified string truncated and ending with ... if the specified string is longer than the specified max length. Otherwise the specified string is returned as is.
